page.title: 05FACCOMBE WOOD
page.content: Faccombe Wood is dominantly coniferous and covers an area of 375 acres, surrounded by approximately 205 acres of arable land. The wood has been re-purchased recently from the Forestry Commision by the new owners of the estate; the previous owners having had to sell the area to cover death duties. A public footpath runs through the wood from North to South, this with other tracks has been widened to provide fire breaks. There is a profusion of wild flowers including snowdrops and daffodils. A footpath leading to derelict Curzon Street Farm passes through uncultivated downland rich in wild flowers including orchids; and butterflies including Chalkhill Blue. The policy of the estate is to not spray within 6m of boundaries of fields to protect wildlife.
